body.para: Is that in the initial setup screen ("Add Account") I don't have the checkbox option "Automatically set up account". I can't figure out how to properly set up SMTP from any other instructions available on the internet.
Gmail does not provide other instructions for how to set up SMTP on Mac Mail.
What I see: In Accounts > {my mail account}
Outgoing Mail Server (SMTP): My dropdown list has "None" selected.
I click on the dropdown and have the option "Edit Server List". I select this.
A new window pops up. I click the [ + ] button to add an SMTP server. (Now we're entering a sublimely crappy Mac UI....)
I get a tabular-type layout that has a column "Server name" with "double click to edit" underneath. I enter smtp.gmail.com.
(I have also tried this with smtp.gmail.com:[email address] )
I have a tab that says "Advanced". It contains: A Server Port text entry field [set to 25] A checkbox with "Use SSL" [unchecked] A dropdown menu labeled "Authentication" [set to none]
The options in the authentication dropdown menu are: None MD5... NTLM... Kerberos... Password
I tried selecting password and entering my authentication info, and it didn't work.
